dublin_core.description: Interactive network visualization of modern agentic AI system architecture using the Model Context Protocol (MCP). Shows components, data flows, and security layers required for deploying AI systems safely in enterprise investor relations contexts.

educational.topic: Agentic AI Systems and Model Context Protocol Implementation
learning_objectives: Understand the components of a modern agentic AI system architecture
Analyze how the Model Context Protocol enables secure enterprise AI deployment
Evaluate the security and governance mechanisms required for AI in sensitive business contexts
Create architecture diagrams for proposed AI implementations in investor relations
prerequisites: Understanding of basic AI concepts (LLMs, prompts, responses)
Awareness of investor relations workflows and data needs
Basic understanding of system architecture diagrams
assessment_opportunities: Can students identify and describe each component type?
Can they explain the purpose and benefits of MCP in enterprise AI?
Can they trace complete data flow from user request to response?
Can they design their own AI architecture for specific use cases?

simulation_model.methodology: Network graph with force-directed layout representing enterprise AI architecture

component_categories.description: Foundation AI capabilities including language models and autonomous reasoning
Model Context Protocol implementation for standardized data access
External and internal data sources accessed via MCP
Specialized AI capabilities extending core LLM functionality
Access control and compliance logging mechanisms
Application layer where IR team interacts with AI

data_flows.data_retrieval_flow: Agent → MCP Client → MCP Server → Data Source → MCP Server → MCP Client → Agent
data_flows.audit_flow: Agent → Audit Trail, MCP Server → Audit Trail

key_architectural_patterns: Standardized data access via MCP protocol
Separation of concerns (UI, logic, data, security)
mcp_benefits: Modular architecture (add sources without code changes)
assumptions: MCP Server handles all data source integrations
Single LLM provider (can be extended to multiple)
limitations: Does not show network infrastructure or deployment topology
Does not detail caching, load balancing, or failover mechanisms
Omits integration with existing enterprise systems (SSO, monitoring, etc.)

pedagogical_context.instructional_strategy: Interactive exploration with multiple filtered views progressing from overview to detailed analysis
pedagogical_context.cognitive_load: High - complex system with many interrelated components
learning_progression: Explore individual components and their purposes
Understand MCP protocol role in data mediation
Trace complete data flows through architecture
Synthesize learning by designing custom architectures
common_misconceptions: MCP is just another API (it's a standardized protocol with security/governance built-in)
Agentic AI is just chatbots (it's autonomous multi-step reasoning with tool use)
Direct LLM access to data is simpler (MCP provides essential security and governance)
Audit trails are optional overhead (required for compliance and debugging)
Architecture is one-size-fits-all (must be adapted to specific use cases and risk profiles)
